intro: Rhododendron arfakianum, commonly known as the Arfak rhododendron, is a species native to the highlands of New Guinea. It is a deciduous shrub that typically grows in cool, humid climates at elevations ranging from 1,000 to 2,500 meters. The plant features dark green, elliptical leaves and produces clusters of bell-shaped, pinkish-white flowers in the spring. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with similar ecological requirements. The species is valued for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in gardens with acidic soil and partial shade.
